attributes.title: Training Neural Networks in Hybrid Differential Equations

children: Training Neural Networks in Hybrid Differential Equations
Hybrid differential equations are differential equations with implicit or explicit discontinuities as specified by
. In the following example, explicit dosing times are given for a pharmacometric model and the universal differential equation is trained to uncover the missing dynamical equations.
# use this p as the initial condition!
# n_ode.p stores the initial parameters of the neural ODE
are compatible with events for ODEs.
can also handle events for SDEs. Use
if the event terminates the time evolution and several states are saved. Currently, the continuous adjoint sensitivities do not support multiple events per time point.
All methods based on discrete sensitivity analysis via automatic differentiation, like
is demonstrated above), are compatible with events. This applies to SDEs, DAEs, and DDEs as well.
